{{short description|Adûnaic word}}
{{cleanup}}
'''''Bêl''''' is a verb stem which means "to befriend" or "to love" in [[Adûnaic]].<ref name=":0">{{PM|Ros}}, p. 373</ref><ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-422971071.html|articlename=Ad. #bêl- v.|author=Paul Strack|accessed=24 November 2024}}</ref><ref name=":1" />

==Etymology==

==See also==
*[[Ar-Belzagar|Belzagar]] could be an Adûnaic translation of the [[Quenya]] word [[Tar-Calmacil|''Calmacil'']], which means "Light-sword".<ref>{{HM|UT}}, p.222</ref> In this case ''bêl'' could mean "light". It is not clear whether [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] changed the meaning of ''bêl'' at some point, or whether these two meanings co-exist<ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://www.elfdict.com/wt/492312|articlename=bêl-|accessed=24 November 2024|author=Parf Edhellen: and elvish dictionary}}</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-2905278807.html|articlename=Ad. ''Belzagar'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=24 November 2024}}</ref>.
*''[[Azrubêl]]'' from ''Azar'' ("sea") and the stem -bêl, translates to "Sea-lover"<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite web|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-379383095.html|articlename=Ad. Azrubêl m.|author=Paul Strack|accessed=24 November 2024}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{HM|SD}} p. 305</ref>.
